claim: mclaren - mercedes have the lowest q1 po

2. Find the qualifying position (q1 pos) of McLaren - Mercedes: From Row 1, q1 pos for McLaren - Mercedes is 1.

3. Compare the qualifying positions of all drivers/constructors with that of McLaren - Mercedes: To do this, we need to go through each row and compare the value of q1 pos (column) with the one found in Row 1.

4. Determine the minimum value among all the qualifying positions: If we find a value smaller than 1 anywhere during our comparison, it means that McLaren - Mercedes does not have the lowest q1 position. Otherwise, it will be the lowest.

5. Final answer: Based on the comparison and determining the minimum value, we can conclude whether McLaren - Mercedes has the lowest q1 position or not.

christijan albers be the only driver with an accident
resp:
1. Identify the driver we are looking for: Christijan Albers.
2. Check the table to find the row where Christijan Albers' data is located. In this case, it is Row 20.
3. Check the 'q1 + q2 time' column for this row to see if there is any data. There isn't, but there is a note about an accident in q2.
4. Compare this information with other rows: No other driver has a missing 'q1 + q2 time', so if there was another driver with an accident, it would have been recorded.
5. Based on the above observations, determine whether Christijan Albers was the only driver with an accident. Since no other drivers have a missing 'q1 + q2 time' and we know that an accident in q2 prevented Albers from setting a 'q1 + q2 time', it is reasonable to conclude that he was the only driver with an accident during this qualifying session.
